verses.text: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

similars.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.
What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?
For behold, God hath said a man being evil cannot do that which is good; for if he offereth a gift, or prayeth unto God, except he shall do it with real intent it profiteth him nothing.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

verses.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

similars.text: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.
Thou shalt be perfect with the Lord thy God.
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

verses.text: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

similars.text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:
Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
How can we expect that God will stay his hand in judgment against us?
Therefore remember, O man, for all thy doings thou shalt be brought into judgment.
But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
For when the Lord shall appear he shall be terrible unto them, that fear may seize upon them, and they shall stand afar off and tremble.

verses.text: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

similars.text: If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.

verses.text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

similars.text: Thou shalt not take thy brother's garment; thou shalt pay for that which thou shalt receive of thy brother.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother's wife: it is thy brother's nakedness.
When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and shall say: Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let not this ruin come under thy hand--
When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:
When thou dost lend thy brother any thing, thou shalt not go into his house to fetch his pledge.
And if a man shall take his brother's wife, it is an unclean thing: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.
For thy violence against thy brother Jacob shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.
And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.

verses.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

similars.text: For it was said to me by the word of the Lord, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.
Thou gavest also thy good spirit to instruct them, and withheldest not thy manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for their thirst.
When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue faileth for thirst, I the Lord will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
Thou shalt not be idle; for he that is idle shall not eat the bread nor wear the garments of the laborer.

But camest back, and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place, of the which the Lord did say to thee, Eat no bread, and drink no water; thy carcase shall not come unto the sepulchre of thy fathers.

Is it not to deal thy bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the poor that are cast out to thy house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
Neither hath oppressed any, hath not withholden the pledge, neither hath spoiled by violence, but hath given his bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment,
Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink: that ye might know that I am the Lord your God.

They shall not offer wine offerings to the Lord, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the Lord.

And the Lord provided for them that they should hunger not, neither should they thirst; yea, and he also gave them strength, that they should suffer no manner of afflictions, save it were swallowed up in the joy of Christ. Now this was according to the prayer of Alma; and this because he prayed in faith.
And the man of God said unto the king, If thou wilt give me half thine house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place:

verses.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

similars.text: The heavens he made; the earth is his footstool; and the foundation thereof is his. Behold, he laid it, an host of men hath he brought in upon the face thereof.
And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

verses.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

similars.text: For, behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the people: but the Lord shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.
Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

verses.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

similars.text: For behold, my brethren, it is given unto you to judge, that ye may know good from evil; and the way to judge is as plain, that ye may know with a perfect knowledge, as the daylight is from the dark night.

verses.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

similars.text: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.
Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

verses.text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

similars.text: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:

verses.text: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

similars.text: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
And the Lord your God, he shall expel them from before you, and drive them from out of your sight; and ye shall possess their land, as the Lord your God hath promised unto you.
And he said, Ye have taken away my gods which I made, and the priest, and ye are gone away: and what have I more? and what is this that ye say unto me, What aileth thee?
Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

similars.text: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

similars.text: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:
The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:
The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

verses.text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

similars.text: For our God is a consuming fire.

verses.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

similars.text: The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.
Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:
For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.
Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
Thou shalt be perfect with the Lord thy God.
Arise; for this matter belongeth unto thee: we also will be with thee: be of good courage, and do it.
Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.
Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Go thy way unto thy brother, and first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come unto me with full purpose of heart, and I will receive you.
If ye then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:
Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
And make proposals for peace unto those who have smitten you, according to the voice of the Spirit which is in you, and all things shall work together for your good.
If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
For I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and establish my covenant with you.
When a man's ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:
Verily I say unto you, even now, if he will hearken unto my voice, it shall be well with him. Even so. Amen.
As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.
And now, verily I say unto you, and this is wisdom, make unto yourselves friends with the mammon of unrighteousness, and they will not destroy you.

The Lord do so and much more to Jonathan: but if it please my father to do thee evil, then I will shew it thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and the Lord be with thee, as he hath been with my father.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.
O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
Therefore, wo be unto him that is at ease in Zion!
Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Therefore thou shalt deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the Lord with thee: notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?
Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.
Or canst thou be humble and meek, and conduct thyself wisely before me? Yea, come unto me thy Savior. Amen.
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
Let him, therefore, hearken to your counsel, and I will bless him with a multiplicity of blessings; let him be faithful and true in all things from henceforth, and he shall be great in mine eyes;

I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the thanks and praise which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and preserved you, and has caused that ye should rejoice, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another--
Come up unto me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for it hath made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.
Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
Verily, thus saith the Lord unto you who have assembled yourselves together to receive his will concerning you:
Take good heed therefore unto yourselves, that ye love the Lord your God.
He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.
And I will bring back all the people unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
Go thy way, eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy works.
Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:
Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy unto thee: for I the Lord, which sanctify you, am holy.
And thus shall ye say to him that liveth in prosperity, Peace be both to thee, and peace be to thine house, and peace be unto all that thou hast.
Wo be unto him that crieth: All is well!
And now, behold, we are in thine hand: as it seemeth good and right unto thee to do unto us, do.
And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
Let your heart therefore be perfect with the Lord our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day.
I am the Lord thy God, and I gave unto thee, my servant Joseph, an appointment, and restore all things. Ask what ye will, and it shall be given unto you according to my word.
For behold, I will be with him, and I will sanctify him before the people; for unto him have I given the keys of this kingdom and ministry. Even so. Amen.
And again, verily I say unto you, let my servant Robert B. Thompson help you to write this proclamation, for I am well pleased with him, and that he should be with you;

verses.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

similars.text: O the greatness and the justice of our God! For he executeth all his words, and they have gone forth out of his mouth, and his law must be fulfilled.

Let my servant William Law also receive the keys by which he may ask and receive blessings; let him be humble before me, and be without guile, and he shall receive of my Spirit, even the Comforter, which shall manifest unto him the truth of all things, and shall give him, in the very hour, what he shall say.
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.
Therefore, prepare thy heart to receive and obey the instructions which I am about to give unto you; for all those who have this law revealed unto them must obey the same.
Again I say unto you, hearken and hear and obey the law which I shall give unto you.

For ye dissembled in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the Lord your God, saying, Pray for us unto the Lord our God; and according unto all that the Lord our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of thy law;
And he said, O my Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
For his word ye shall receive, as if from mine own mouth, in all patience and faith.
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.
And he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify among you this day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.

And behold, I have given you the law and the commandments of my Father, that ye shall believe in me, and that ye shall repent of your sins, and come unto me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit. Behold, ye have the commandments before you, and the law is fulfilled.
Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.
I entreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.
Then the Lord put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.
And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.

And the Lord hath said: I will raise up a Moses; and I will give power unto him in a rod; and I will give judgment unto him in writing. Yet I will not loose his tongue, that he shall speak much, for I will not make him mighty in speaking. But I will write unto him my law, by the finger of mine own hand; and I will make a spokesman for him.
This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;
He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.

For behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye have received a commandment for a law unto my church, through him whom I have appointed unto you to receive commandments and revelations from my hand.

Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If the Lord have stirred thee up against me, let him accept an offering: but if they be the children of men, cursed be they before the Lord; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the Lord, saying, Go, serve other gods.
The Lord therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
Hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation: for a law shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest for a light of the people.
Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.
Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.
Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation; for a law shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest for a light for the people.
Take with you words, and turn to the Lord: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.

And he said unto them, These are the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.
And by the prayer of your faith ye shall receive my law, that ye may know how to govern my church and have all things right before me.
Let him assist my servant Joseph, and also let my servant William Law assist my servant Joseph, in making a solemn proclamation unto the kings of the earth, even as I have before said unto you.
And it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken diligently unto my commandments which I command you this day, to love the Lord your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

If thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law, and if thou turn unto the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul.

But behold, I, Jacob, would speak unto you that are pure in heart. Look unto God with firmness of mind, and pray unto him with exceeding faith, and he will console you in your afflictions, and he will plead your cause, and send down justice upon those who seek your destruction.
Thus saith the Lord, verily, verily I say unto you my son, thy sins are forgiven thee, according to thy petition, for thy prayers and the prayers of thy brethren have come up into my ears.
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
The Lord hath heard my supplication; the Lord will receive my prayer.
And I have put my words in thy mouth, and I have covered thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion, Thou art my people.
Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the Lord, since I have shewed you kindness, that ye will also shew kindness unto my father's house, and give me a true token:
Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the Lord's law may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath the Lord brought thee out of Egypt.
Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

verses.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

similars.text: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.
If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
O Israel, return unto the Lord thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
Wherefore now return, and go in peace, that thou displease not the lords of the Philistines.
Lord, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

Therefore thus saith the Lord, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.
Nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house unto my name.

Blessed art thou and thy children; and they shall be blessed, inasmuch as they shall keep my commandments they shall prosper in the land. But remember, inasmuch as they will not keep my commandments they shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
In righteousness shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.
And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.

Thus saith the Lord, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren the children of Israel: return every man to his house; for this thing is from me. They hearkened therefore to the word of the Lord, and returned to depart, according to the word of the Lord.
Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith the Lord, Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in:
Then shalt thou say, O Lord, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
Therefore thus saith the Lord; I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies: my house shall be built in it, saith the Lord of hosts, and a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.
For thus saith the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.

After many days thou shalt be visited: in the latter years thou shalt come into the land that is brought back from the sword, and is gathered out of many people, against the mountains of Israel, which have been always waste: but it is brought forth out of the nations, and they shall dwell safely all of them.
For the Lord God hath said that: Inasmuch as ye shall keep my commandments ye shall prosper in the land; and inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from my presence.

Nevertheless, ye shall not cast him out of your synagogues, or your places of worship, for unto such shall ye continue to minister; for ye know not but what they will return and repent, and come unto me with full purpose of heart, and I shall heal them; and ye shall be the means of bringing salvation unto them.

Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto me and I will return unto you, saith the Lord of Hosts. But ye say: Wherein shall we return?
And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was shewed thee in the mount.
If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.

verses.text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

similars.text: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
And thou shalt make ouches of gold;
O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted! Behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colors, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.

verses.text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

similars.text: And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do after the will of your God.
But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated unto the Lord: they shall come into the treasury of the Lord.

verses.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

similars.text: Delight thyself also in the Lord; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
The Lord make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be steadfast, and shalt not fear:
And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.
And said, O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to thee, my God: for our iniquities are increased over our head, and our trespass is grown up unto the heavens.
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name Jah, and rejoice before him.
O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.
And thy renown went forth among the heathen for thy beauty: for it was perfect through my comeliness, which I had put upon thee, saith the Lord God.
And thou shalt rejoice in every good thing which the Lord thy God hath given unto thee, and unto thine house, thou, and the Levite, and the stranger that is among you.
Take good heed therefore unto yourselves, that ye love the Lord your God.
Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Behold, my beloved brethren, I speak unto you these things that ye may rejoice, and lift up your heads forever, because of the blessings which the Lord God shall bestow upon your children.
Thou shalt be perfect with the Lord thy God.
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
And thou shalt offer peace offerings, and shalt eat there, and rejoice before the Lord thy God.
O all ye that are pure in heart, lift up your heads and receive the pleasing word of God, and feast upon his love; for ye may, if your minds are firm, forever.
And the meek also shall increase, and their joy shall be in the Lord, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
Praise ye the Lord: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.
Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
The meek also shall increase their joy in the Lord, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

Then shalt thou delight thyself in the Lord; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.
Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for praise is comely for the upright.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
Behold, my soul abhorreth sin, and my heart delighteth in righteousness; and I will praise the holy name of my God.
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the Lord your God.
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The Lord reigneth.

But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.
I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.
And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord, will I seek.
And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the Lord your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.
For thou art an holy people unto the Lord thy God: the Lord thy God hath chosen thee to be a special people unto himself, above all people that are upon the face of the earth.
Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
Wherefore, lift up thy heart and rejoice, and cleave unto the covenants which thou hast made.
God be merciful unto us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.
For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

For the Lord hath heard thy prayers, and hath judged of thy righteousness, and hath sent me to declare unto thee that thou mayest rejoice; and that thou mayest declare unto thy people, that they may also be filled with joy.
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
Thou shalt thank the Lord thy God in all things.
For the Lord taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.
Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

Blessed art thou, Alma; therefore, lift up thy head and rejoice, for thou hast great cause to rejoice; for thou hast been faithful in keeping the commandments of God from the time which thou receivedst thy first message from him. Behold, I am he that delivered it unto you.
If thou art sorrowful, call on the Lord thy God with supplication, that your souls may be joyful.
He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.
Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.
Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.
Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
And all nations shall call you blessed, for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of Hosts.
And all nations shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of hosts.
Let thy heart be of good cheer before my face; and thou shalt bear record of my name, not only unto the Gentiles, but also unto the Jews; and thou shalt send forth my word unto the ends of the earth.
Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.
But thou, O Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
And the Lord said unto Joshua, Get thee up; wherefore liest thou thus upon thy face?
Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.
Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.
For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord shall reward thee.
Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be steadfast, and shalt not fear:
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

Then shalt thou delight thyself in the Lord; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

verses.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

similars.text: When thou shalt vow a vow unto the Lord thy God, thou shalt not slack to pay it: for the Lord thy God will surely require it of thee; and it would be sin in thee.
Go thou near, and hear all that the Lord our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that the Lord our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
Thou shalt therefore obey the voice of the Lord thy God, and do his commandments and his statutes, which I command thee this day.

And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe and to do all his commandments which I command thee this day, that the Lord thy God will set thee on high above all nations of the earth:
Yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord my God, to hearken unto the cry and to the prayer, which thy servant prayeth before thee to day:
Thou hast avouched the Lord this day to be thy God, and to walk in his ways, and to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and to hearken unto his voice:
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Vow, and pay unto the Lord your God: let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;
And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
Be thou humble; and the Lord thy God shall lead thee by the hand, and give thee answer to thy prayers.
Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord my God, to hearken unto the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:
Only if thou carefully hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.
And it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken diligently unto my commandments which I command you this day, to love the Lord your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
And thou shalt be ordained under his hand to expound scriptures, and to exhort the church, according as it shall be given thee by my Spirit.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.
Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.
And behold, if the Lord shall say unto a man--Because of thine iniquities, thou shalt be accursed forever--it shall be done.
And all these blessings shall come on thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God.

If thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law, and if thou turn unto the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul.
Incline your ear, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall live; and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.
Hear my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come unto thee.
Thou shalt be perfect with the Lord thy God.
When thou shalt hearken to the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the Lord thy God.
Again I say unto you, hearken and hear and obey the law which I shall give unto you.

And the Lord shall make thee the head, and not the tail; and thou shalt be above only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if that thou hearken unto the commandments of the Lord thy God, which I command thee this day, to observe and to do them:
I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know the Lord.
Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.

If thou doest well, thou shalt be accepted. And if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door, and Satan desireth to have thee; and except thou shalt hearken unto my commandments, I will deliver thee up, and it shall be unto thee according to his desire. And thou shalt rule over him;

And secondly, he doth require that ye should do as he hath commanded you; for which if ye do, he doth immediately bless you; and therefore he hath paid you. And ye are still indebted unto him, and are, and will be, forever and ever; therefore, of what have ye to boast?
I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
And hearken thou to the supplication of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place: and hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place: and when thou hearest, forgive.
Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath the Lord answered thee? and, What hath the Lord spoken?
And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.

For I will make my people with whom the Father hath covenanted, yea, I will make thy horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass. And thou shalt beat in pieces many people; and I will consecrate their gain unto the Lord, and their substance unto the Lord of the whole earth. And behold, I am he who doeth it.
And now, O Lord God, thou art that God, and thy words be true, and thou hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:
That thou shouldest enter into covenant with the Lord thy God, and into his oath, which the Lord thy God maketh with thee this day:
Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.
And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
For he shall lay his hands upon thee, and thou shalt receive the Holy Ghost, and thy time shall be given to writing, and to learning much.
I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people.
I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people,
And, as it is written--Whatsoever ye shall ask in faith, being united in prayer according to my command, ye shall receive.
And again, I command thee that thou shalt pray vocally as well as in thy heart; yea, before the world as well as in secret, in public as well as in private.
Thou shalt stand abroad, and the man to whom thou dost lend shall bring out the pledge abroad unto thee.
And shalt return unto the Lord thy God, and shalt obey his voice according to all that I command thee this day, thou and thy children, with all thine heart, and with all thy soul;
My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O Lord; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.

verses.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

similars.text: And blessed be he that shall bring this thing to light; for it shall be brought out of darkness unto light, according to the word of God; yea, it shall be brought out of the earth, and it shall shine forth out of darkness, and come unto the knowledge of the people; and it shall be done by the power of God.
Verily I say unto you all: Arise and shine forth, that thy light may be a standard for the nations;
The Lord shall establish thee an holy people unto himself, as he hath sworn unto thee, if thou shalt keep the commandments of the Lord thy God, and walk in his ways.
I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
But verily I say unto you, that I have decreed a decree which my people shall realize, inasmuch as they hearken from this very hour unto the counsel which I, the Lord their God, shall give unto them.
And Moses said, This is the thing which the Lord commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the Lord shall appear unto you.

The light which is in all things, which giveth life to all things, which is the law by which all things are governed, even the power of God who sitteth upon his throne, who is in the bosom of eternity, who is in the midst of all things.
And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
Arise, shine; for thy light is come, and the glory of the Lord is risen upon thee.
And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;
And thou shalt be ordained under his hand to expound scriptures, and to exhort the church, according as it shall be given thee by my Spirit.
For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
Therefore now, Lord, let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.

In that I command thee this day to love the Lord thy God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes and his judgments, that thou mayest live and multiply: and the Lord thy God shall bless thee in the land whither thou goest to possess it.
And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
For, behold, it is I that speak; behold, I am the light which shineth in darkness, and by my power I give these words unto thee.
And thou shalt make the seven lamps thereof: and they shall light the lamps thereof, that they may give light over against it.
For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord:
And then shall the righteous shine forth in the kingdom of God.
We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:
And thine house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
And behold, I, the Lord, declare unto you, and my words are sure and shall not fail, that they shall obtain it.
Therefore, let it be built after the manner which I shall show unto three of you, whom ye shall appoint and ordain unto this power.
The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
And thou shalt be obedient unto the things which I shall give unto him, even as Aaron, to declare faithfully the commandments and the revelations, with power and authority unto the church.

And now, behold, I give unto you a commandment, that when ye are assembled together ye shall instruct and edify each other, that ye may know how to act and direct my church, how to act upon the points of my law and commandments, which I have given.

verses.text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

similars.text: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.

For the things which some men esteem to be of great worth, both to the body and soul, others set at naught and trample under their feet. Yea, even the very God of Israel do men trample under their feet; I say, trample under their feet but I would speak in other words--they set him at naught, and hearken not to the voice of his counsels.
The Lord lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.
Thou shalt not see thy brother's ass or his ox fall down by the way, and hide thyself from them: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again.

And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:
Behold, his soul which is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith.
Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.
And when he hath taken away the multitude, his heart shall be lifted up; and he shall cast down many ten thousands: but he shall not be strengthened by it.

And my Father sent me that I might be lifted up upon the cross; and after that I had been lifted up upon the cross, that I might draw all men unto me, that as I have been lifted up by men even so should men be lifted up by the Father, to stand before me, to be judged of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil--

verses.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.

similars.text: Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.
